title.native: ONE PIECE THE MOVIE オマツリ男爵と秘密の島
title.romaji: ONE PIECE THE MOVIE: Omatsuri Danshaku to Himitsu no Shima
title.english: One Piece: Baron Omatsuri and the Secret Island

description:
The Straw Hat crew obtain an advertisement for a recreational island on the Grand Line run by the Baron Omatsuri. Luffy decides to take this opportunity to kick back and relax. Unfortunately, when they arrive at the island, they are asked to compete in contests through unity for access to relaxation. However, there seems to be a mysterious air on the island, as the Straw Hat Pirates begin to fight amongst themselves, while Robin, Chopper, and Luffy individually search for the secret behind Baron Omatsuri's island.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: One Piece: El barón Omatsuri y la isla de los secretos
One Piece - L'isola segreta del barone Omatsuri

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

title.native: ONE PIECE 呪われた聖剣
ONE PIECE THE MOVIE カラクリ城のメカ巨兵

name.native: トニートニー・チョッパー

node.description: Executive Director of Toei Animation. He first joined the company in 1977 and has produced many of its most popular anime titles, including launching the *One Piece* anime in 1999.

German actor and voice actor most well known for voicing Bunny Tsukino in Sailor Moon (season 2-5 and movies). She was also the director of dubbing for 52 + episodes of Inuyasha and the dubbing director of One Piece.

German actor and voice actor most well known for voicing Bunny Tsukino in Sailor Moon (season 2-5 and movies). She was also the director of dubbing for 52 + episodes of Inuyasha and the dubbing director of One Piece.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sushio_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sushiogumicompany/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%99%E3%81%97%E3%81%8A)

Ishizaki Toshio, better known as Sushio, is an animator, illustrator and character designer working for [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Academy, he joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). He debuted as an in-betweener in [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/), as a key animator on [Berserk](https://anilist.co/anime/33/), and as an animation director on [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/276/). In 2007, he served as a character designer for the first time on [Kiss Dum: Engage Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/2106/). He was a key staff member at Gainax for a long time, but left in 2011 when [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/) and others established the anime production company Trigger. There he was given the job of handling the character designs for [Kill la Kill](https://anilist.co/anime/18679/), the first TV series produced by the newly-found studio.

Specializes in action and effects, and his skills attract a lot of attention in the industry.

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Favorite Animal:__ Big gentle dogs
__Favorite Mangaka:__ [Akira Toriyama](https://anilist.co/staff/96901/Akira-Toriyama)
__Favorite Music:__ '70s soul music
__Favorite Real-Life Pirate:__ Edward Teach (Blackbeard)
__Favorite Video Game:__ Puyo Puyo
__Trivia:__
- Oda is married to Chiaki Inaba, who had played Nami during Jump Festa One Piece stage performances.
- In a recent Japanese fan poll, Oda is currently ranked the 48th Most Popular Character in [One Piece](https://anilist.co/manga/30013/One-Piece/), despite the fact that he has never included himself in any issue of the manga (excluding SBS).
- He voiced the character ["Odacchi" (オダッチ)](https://anilist.co/character/12281/Eiichirou-Oda) in a [soccer-themed short](https://anilist.co/anime/2386/ONE-PIECE-Yume-no-Soccer-Ou/) that aired with the [3rd One Piece Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/461/One-Piece-Choppers-Kingdom-on-the-Island-of-Strange-Animals/). "Odacchi" is Oda's nickname, and he played soccer when he was younger.
- Oda is a fan of rapper Eminem, filmmaker Quentin Tarantino and [Tim Burton](https://anilist.co/staff/323667/Timothy-Walter-Burton).
- Oda's 3 favorite movies are Seven Samurai, The Nightmare Before Christmas, and Young Guns.
- According to Oda in an interview for US Shonen Jump, his favorite villain in One Piece is [Buggy the Clown](https://anilist.co/character/725/Buggy) (he joked that he literally threw him together).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山下高明)

Takaaki Yamashita is an animator who frequently works with director Mamoru Hosoda. He was born in Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan in 1966 and is a graduate of Kyushu University. He is particularly known his precise recreation of natural movement, which makes his scenes look very live action film like.

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenokun)

Kouhei attended Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music (Music Faculty, Composition Department), studying under Tomojirou Ikenouchi and other professors. He worked for three consecutive years at Victor Music Industries after he graduated from the University. He attended Berklee College of Music for two years after he left Victor Music Industries. After returning to Japan, Kouhei started his activities as a composer.

Though Kouhei had been playing at the hotel at first, he was requested to compose an insert song for "Arcadia of My Youth: Endless Orbit SSX", a 1982 TV anime, and it became his first work as a composer. Afterwards, he handled some more compositions of insert songs, this time for the Super Sentai series and he also did the composition of the background music for a TV anime, Konpora Kid, in 1985.

Notably, the score for [Top wo Nerae! Gunbuster](https://anilist.co/anime/949/) made his name and talent very famous among anime fans, and is recognized as one of his most important works. He also handled the composition of [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/) and showed a peculiar arrangement, which he added to his previous 17-year-old work. Another of his most important work is often said to be [Yuusha-Ou GaoGaiGar](https://anilist.co/anime/890/), and the [sequel](https://anilist.co/anime/1382/) following it.

In 2002, he won the first Tokyo Anime Award for Best Music for his work on [Overman King Gainer](https://anilist.co/anime/1792/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2256470167)

After graduating from high school, Kubota went through training at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s research center before dropping out and joining [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1998. Three years later in he met [Sushio](https://anilist.co/staff/103619/) at Comiket, which led to Kubota joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he made his debut as an animation director on the premiere of [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/277/)'s second season.

In 2005, he made his debut as a character designer, although still jointly together with Sushio and [Takaaki Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/110187/), on the 6th [One Piece](https://anilist.co/anime/464/) movie. The film was directed by Mamoru Hosoda, which led to Kubota getting an invite to join the production of [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/) as an animation director. After this he kept working at Gainax until going freelance.

In 2012, he worked as the main character designer on [From the New World](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/) and [Robotics;Notes](https://anilist.co/anime/13599/), and a few years later he served as one on [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/), which earned him international fame.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2256470167)

Three years later in he met [Sushio](https://anilist.co/staff/103619/) at Comiket, which led to Kubota joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he made his debut as an animation director on the premiere of [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/277/)'s second season.

In 2005, he made his debut as a character designer, although still jointly together with Sushio and [Takaaki Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/110187/), on the 6th [One Piece](https://anilist.co/anime/464/) movie. The film was directed by Mamoru Hosoda, which led to Kubota getting an invite to join the production of [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/) as an animation director. After this he kept working at Gainax until going freelance.

In 2012, he worked as the main character designer on [From the New World](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/) and [Robotics;Notes](https://anilist.co/anime/13599/), and a few years later he served as one on [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/), which earned him international fame.

**Hiroshi Takahashi** is the president of Toei Animation.

Takahashi graduated 1967 from Sophia University and joined with Asahi National Broadcasting (no TV Asahi) where he worked in the organisation field. In 1997 he became public relations manager at BS Asahi.

He became managing director at Toei Animation in 2001, executive director in 2002 and finally president in 2003.
Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山下高明)

Takaaki Yamashita is an animator who frequently works with director Mamoru Hosoda. He was born in Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan in 1966 and is a graduate of Kyushu University. He is particularly known his precise recreation of natural movement, which makes his scenes look very live action film like.

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/安藤正浩)

Originating from [Oh! Production](https://anilist.co/studio/234/), Affiliated to [A.C.G.T](https://anilist.co/studio/179/ACGT).

At Oh!, he assisted [Kazuo Komatsubara](https://anilist.co/staff/129558/) on animation direction for the 1987 [Devilman](https://anilist.co/anime/2354/) OVA. Andou eventually moved to [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) to serve as character designer for [Junichi Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/99002/)'s [Mable Town Stories](https://anilist.co/anime/5203/). He became an integral part of the animation staff for [Kingyo Chuuihou!](https://anilist.co/anime/727/) and [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/).

After that, after a period of activity centered on Toei and Triangle Staff works, he has seated at A.C.G.T.

_Note: Not to be confused with younger animator and director [Masahiro Andou](https://anilist.co/staff/101518/)._
